intro: Bosqueiopsis gilletii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with gray-green, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is extensive and adapted to extract moisture from deep underground sources. Bosqueiopsis gilletii plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity in desert ecosystems.
